description:
When creating a vm qemu-nbd returned error code and created ephemeral disk with 5 gigs instead of requested 350gigs. After nova rootwrap returned non-0 code I assume vm creation should fail. 


1. Openstack version:
ii  nova-compute                     1:2014.2-fuel6.0~mira19                    OpenStack Compute - compute node base

2. Log files:
attached nova-compute.log

3. Reproduce steps:
it happened once, don't know how to reproduce

Expeceted result:
vm ends up in error state

Actual result:
vm started but with smaller disk than requested
title: VM created even though root disk creation failed.

comments.content:
Hi,
there are 2 issues here. 
1 is the problem with creating the disk, the second is that, the VM was created even though the disk creation failed, and this bug about the latter. My undestanding is that the VM should never start if there was any failure during disk creation process. Unfortunatelly in my case VM was created and started, but the disk size did not match parameters requested in flavor.

Additionally same requests works on other nodes, so it was not the problem with mount command ( I believe it might have been hardware issue, but I'm not sure about it  ).
